Yes, of course. Sporting CP has formed two strategic partnerships - one with New York City FC, and another with Shandong Luneng in China. 

With New York City FC, Sporting CP has established a strategic partnership that includes player development, scouting, and marketing initiatives. As part of the agreement, Sporting CP has loaned several of its young talents to New York City FC to provide them with valuable experience on the American continent. Sporting CP also collaborates with New York City FC in identifying and scouting young football players in the United States, with Florida and New York state being the initial focus areas.

The partnership with Shandong Luneng involves collaborations to promote sport, education, and culture in China and Portugal. This partnership provides Sporting CP exclusive rights to conduct football camps in China, which enables them to scout young talent in the country.

These partnerships have allowed Sporting CP to expand its sphere of influence far beyond Portugal borders, sharing technical and commercial knowledge and mutual growth opportunities while broadening their fan base. Sporting CP, through these mutually beneficial collaborations, is keen to develop new business facets and, more significantly, to nurture relationships with fans and provide unique sporting experiences globally.

Overall, these partnerships showcase Sporting CP's strategy to expand their network with global football stakeholders as they focus on creating growth opportunities and revenue across key regions.
